definitions.definition: A favorable opportunity ; a convenient or timely chance .
examples: At this point, she seized the occasion to make her own observation.
On this occasion , I'm going to decline your offer, but next time I might agree.

definitions.definition: An occurrence or state of affairs which causes some event or reaction; a motive or reason .
examples: I had no occasion to feel offended, however.

definitions.definition: Something which causes something else; a cause .
A particular happening; an instance or time when something occurred.
examples: I could think of two separate occasions when she had deliberately lied to me.
a momentous occasion in the history of South Africa
I have no occasion for firearms.
Having people round for dinner was always quite an occasion at our house.

definitions.definition: A reason or excuse; a motive; a persuasion.

main_definition: A favorable opportunity ; a convenient or timely chance . [from 14th c.]
secondary_definitions: An occurrence or state of affairs which causes some event or reaction; a motive or reason . [from 14th c.]
Something which causes something else; a cause . [from 14th c.]
( obsolete ) An occurrence or incident . [14th–18th c.]
A particular happening; an instance or time when something occurred. [from 15th c.]
A special event or function. [from 19th c.]
A reason or excuse; a motive; a persuasion.
